newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela Feb car sales up 98 pct vs year ago. [CORRECTED 10:10 GMT 8/3]
newsitem.headline: Venezuela Feb car sales up 98 pct vs year ago. [CORRECTED 10:10 GMT 8/3]

text.p: Vehicle sales in Venezuela jumped 98.3 percent in February to 7,597 compared to 3,831 (Corrects percentage change and figures) in February 1996, the Venezuelan Automobile Chamber (CAVENEZ) said Friday.
Vehicle sales in February were also up 14.4 percent from 6,638 units (Corrects percentage change and figures) in January, the CAVENEZ figures showed.
Sales for the first two months of the year, at 14,295 units, were up 108.1 percent from 6,867 (Corrects percentage change and figures) in the same period last year.

In February, 6,615 (87 percent) of the vehicles sold were assembled locally and 982 (13 percent) imported. In February 1996, 3,503 (91 percent) were locally assembled and 328 (nine percent) imported. (Corrects percentage change and figures).

General Motors Corp led the Venezuelan market with 31 percent of total sales in the first two months. Ford Motor Co followed with 23 percent, Toyota Motor Corp with 15 percent, Chrysler Corp with 10 percent, Mitsubishi Motors with nine percent and Fiat SpA with eight percent. (Corrects percentages).
